perturbation.original_text:
BY DOWNLOADING OR INSTALLING THE SOFTWARE, OR USING THE EQUIPMENT THAT CONTAINS THIS SOFTWARE, YOU ARE
BINDING THE BUSINESS ENTITY THAT YOU REPRESENT ("CUSTOMER") TO THIS AGREEMENT. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO ALL OF THE
TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT, THEN (A) DO NOT DOWNLOAD, INSTALL OR USE THE SOFTWARE, AND (B) YOU MAY RETURN THE
SOFTWARE FOR A FULL REFUND, OR, IF THE SOFTWARE IS SUPPLIED AS PART OF ANOTHER PRODUCT, YOU MAY RETURN THE
ENTIRE PRODUCT FOR A FULL REFUND. YOUR RIGHT TO RETURN AND REFUND EXPIRES 30 DAYS AFTER PURCHASE FROM CISCO OR
AN AUTHORIZED CISCO RESELLER, AND APPLIES ONLY IF CUSTOMER IS THE ORIGINAL END USER PURCHASER.
perturbation.changed_text:
BY DOWNLOADING OR INSTALLING THE SOFTWARE, OR USING THE EQUIPMENT THAT CONTAINS THIS SOFTWARE, YOU ARE
BINDING THE BUSINESS ENTITY THAT YOU REPRESENT ("CLIENT") TO THIS AGREEMENT. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE TO ALL OF THE
TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT, THEN (A) DO NOT DOWNLOAD, INSTALL OR USE THE SOFTWARE, AND (B) YOU MAY RETURN THE
SOFTWARE FOR A PARTIAL REFUND, OR, IF THE SOFTWARE IS SUPPLIED AS PART OF ANOTHER PRODUCT, YOU MAY RETURN THE
ENTIRE PRODUCT FOR A PARTIAL REFUND. YOUR RIGHT TO RETURN AND REFUND EXPIRES 60 DAYS AFTER PURCHASE FROM CISCO OR
AN AUTHORIZED CISCO RESELLER, AND APPLIES ONLY IF CLIENT IS THE ORIGINAL END USER PURCHASER.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'CUSTOMER' to 'CLIENT' and 'FULL REFUND' to 'PARTIAL REFUND' without defining them differently creates confusion about who is bound by the agreement and what the refund policy is. Also, changing 30 days to 60 days.

perturbation.original_text:
License. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Cisco Systems, Inc. or its subsidiary licensing the Software instead of Cisco
Systems, Inc. ("Cisco"), grants to Customer a nonexclusive and nontransferable license to use for Customer's internal business purposes the
Software and the Documentation for which Customer has paid the required license fees. "Documentation" means written information (whether
contained in user or technical manuals, training materials, specifications or otherwise) regarding the Software and made available by Cisco in any
manner (including on CD-Rom, or on-line).
Customer's license to use the Software shall be limited to, and Customer shall not use the Software in excess of, a single hardware chassis or card
or that number of agent(s), concurrent users, sessions, IP addresses, port(s), seat(s), server(s) or site(s), as set forth in the applicable Purchase
Order which has been accepted by Cisco and for which Customer has paid to Cisco the required license fee.
perturbation.changed_text:
License. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Cisco Systems, Inc. or its subsidiary licensing the Software instead of Cisco
Systems, Inc. ("Cisco"), grants to End User a nonexclusive and nontransferable license to use for Customer's internal business purposes the
Software and the Paperwork for which Customer has paid the required license fees. "Documentation" means written information (whether
contained in user or technical manuals, training materials, specifications or otherwise) regarding the Software and made available by Cisco in any
manner (including on CD-Rom, or on-line).
Customer's license to use the Software shall not be limited, and Customer shall use the Software in excess of, a single hardware chassis or card
or that number of agent(s), concurrent users, sessions, IP addresses, port(s), seat(s), server(s) or site(s), as set forth in the applicable Purchase
Order which has been accepted by Cisco and for which End User has paid to Cisco the required license fee.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Customer' to 'End User', 'Documentation' to 'Paperwork' creates contradiction. Furthermore, the change in the limitation clause makes it impossible to determine the amount of access the customer has.

perturbation.original_text:
Consistent with 48 C.F.R.12.212 and 48 C.F.R. 227.7202-1 through 227.7202-4, Customer will provide to Government end user, or, if this Agreement is
direct Government end user will acquire, the Software and software documentation with only those rights set forth herein that apply to non-
governmental customers. Use of this Software and Documentation constitutes agreement by the Government entity that the computer software
and Documentation is commercial, and constitutes acceptance of the rights and restrictions herein.
perturbation.changed_text:
Consistent with 48 C.F.R.12.212 and 48 C.F.R. 227.7202-1 through 227.7202-4, Client will provide to Government end user, or, if this Agreement is
direct Government end user will acquire, the Software and software data with only those rights set forth herein that apply to non-
governmental customers. Use of this Software and Paperwork constitutes agreement by the Government entity that the computer software
and Paperwork is commercial, and constitutes acceptance of the rights and restrictions herein.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Customer' to 'Client', 'Software documentation' to 'software data', and 'Documentation' to 'Paperwork' creates ambiguity regarding government end user rights and obligations.
